src:
Šapovalov razbio Monfisa i obradovao Beretinija
Kanađanin u polufinalu Pariza, a Italijan ide u London

01 Nov 2019

Jedan pobednik, a dvojica slavljenika! Italijan Mateo Beretini je proslavio pobedu Denisa Šapovalova nad Gaelom Monfisom jednako burno kao mladi kanadski teniser. Reklo bi se da su obojica iz ovog meča izašli kao pobednici.
Šapovalov je razbio Monfisa u Bersiju sa 6:2, 6:2 i plasirao se u polufinale mastersa. Međutim, poraz Monfisa označio je i da je završena borba za osmo, poslednje mesto koje vodi na završni masters u Londonu. Poslednja dvojica kandidata bili su upravo tamnoputi Francuz i Italijan Beretini.
Da je Monfis pobedio Šapovalova danas, on bi išao u London. Pošto je izgubio, poslednja rezervacija pripala je Beretiniju, koji će nastupom na završnom mastersu upotpuniti najbolju sezonu u karijeri.
Očekivalo se mnogo više borbe u duelu Šapovalova i Monfisa, ali meč je bio prava teniska „viktorija“. Prvi set je trajao samo 28 minuta i Kanađanin ga je dobio uz dva osvojena brejka. Ništa bolju igru Francuz nije prikazao ni u drugom delu meča. Izgubio je prva dva svoja servis gema i Šapovalov je poveo 4:0, a to je bila prednost koja se ne ispušta.
Mladi kanadski teniser će se za mesto u finalu boriti sa boljim iz poslednjeg četvrtfinalnog duela, koji čine Rafael Nadal i Žo-Vilfred Conga.
Foto: Reuters
text:
Shapovalov broke up Monfis and rejoiced Beretini
A Canadian in the semi-finals of Paris, with the Italian heading to London

01 Nov 2019

One winner and two celebrants! Italian Mateo Beretini celebrated Denis Shapovalov's victory over Gael Monfis just as tumultuously as a young Canadian tennis player. It would be said that both came out victorious in this match.
Shapovalov defeated Monfis at Bersi by 6-2, 6-2 and advanced to the Masters semifinals. However, the defeat of Monfisa also marked the end of the fight for the eighth, the last place leading to the final Masters in London. The last two candidates were the dark-skinned Frenchman and the Italian Beretini.
Had Monfis defeated Shapovalov today, he would have gone to London. After losing, the last booking went to Beretini, who will complete the best season of his career by appearing in the final Masters.
Much more fighting was expected in the duel of Shapovalov and Monfis, but the match was a true "Victoria" tennis match. The first set lasted only 28 minutes and was won by a Canadian with two breaks won. The Frenchman did not show any better game in the other part of the match. He lost the first two games of his game and Shapovalov led 4-0, which was an advantage that is not lost.
The young Canadian tennis player will battle for better place in the final quarterfinal duel of Rafael Nadal and Jo-Wilfred Cong for a place in the finals.
Photo by Reuters
